Tracking

From Peragro Tempus Wiki

Tracking is a function of certain Production Skills. This ability comes in two forms; static tracking and dynamic tracking. Static tracking informs a character/player where to seek items which do not move, having a static location Herbalists engage in static tracking. Dynamic tracking views only the area around the character, seeking signs of passage by others. Dynamic tracking is used by Trainers seeking animals.

Contents

  • 1 Static Tracking
    • 1.1 reuse
  • 2 Dynamic Tracking
    • 2.1 reuse

Static Tracking

When using Static Tracking the character enters the item they are searching for and (assuming it's a legal target for the skill/tracking type) receives a direction/distance. This is updated (refined) periodically, as determined by skill level and the difficulty to track the target in the area. Success/failure determines what is indicated for the reported variables;

  • distance (possible to miss nearer likely spots for more distant spots with poor checks)
  • certainty (chance of a false direction/distance and the severity of that misdirection).

A string of abysmal checks will literally lead the character through an area littered with the target always indicating a way around the subject. An amazingly good check will immediately lead along the shortest open path to the closest concentration of the target that has not been ruled out.

reuse

If a character uses Static Tracking on a subject they have tried before they will restart the attempt with the same target unless they are either a) farther away from both their last position when tracking that subject AND the subject itself than those two positions are from one another. or b) more time has passed than would have been required to move from the last position in which they were tracking that subject than would have been required for them to move to the last "known location" of the subject.


Dynamic Tracking

Success determines the area and minimum marking a tracker can read. Greater time, traffic, and weather over area or use of stealth by the subject all decrease the "marking" of a set of tracks. Further, many types of terrain present penalties to the roll.

When Dynamic Tracking is activated the character receives a list of tracks appropriate to the skill used, within the area dictated by their roll, and with marking no less than their minimum. By selecting one of the tracks the tracker is shown an indicator of the subjects direction of travel (and possibly some other information determined by the tracker's minimum marking minus the individual track's actual marking).

As long as the tracking remains active the character will automatically re-check and re-select the same track each time they leave their previous "area."

reuse

If a character wishes to end a particular Dynamic Tracking attempt and re-try it they must leave the Area of their last attempt.
